wikipedia_page.main: Kenneth Norman Thomson Lee (23 June 1915 – 15 January 2008) was a fighter pilot in the Royal Air Force (RAF).  He flew with 501 Squadron in the Battle of France where he shot down five German bombers to become an ace. On 18 August, he was one of four Hurricane pilots shot down by Gerhard Schöpfel.

response: Kenneth or Ken Lee may refer to:
* Ken Lee (businessman) (1932–2007), co-founder of Bing Lee stores in Australia
* Ken Lee (RAF officer) (1915–2008), British Second World War flying ace
*"Ken Lee", an English-phonetic cover of "Without You" by Badfinger, sung by Valentina Hasan on Bulgarian Music Idol
